greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Odd bisection of A003961: Replace in 2n-1 each prime factor p(k) with prime p(k+1).
comment: This has the same terms as A007310 (Numbers congruent to 1 or 5 mod 6), but in different order. Apart from 1, they are the numbers that occur below the first two rows of arrays like A246278 and A083221 (A083140).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = A007310(A249746(n)). [Permutation of A007310, Numbers congruent to 1 or 5 mod 6.]
xref: Cf. A249734 (the other bisection of A003961).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 23 2014
